div.h1: Welcome to the Splunk App for Software Supply Chain!
div.p: This App was created to provide consolodated views across all of your CI/CD tools in your Software Delivery Life Cycle. By Searching the data from these tools, Splunk can quickly provide you valuable insights that can help reduce downtime and security incidents.

h2.b: Source Control Management (SCM) - Github, Gitlab, Bitbucket...

div.p:
Use the data from your SCM repositories to drive value in Splunk across the SDLC and your "as code" efforts.
The "Enterprise Server Monitor" drop down has several dashboards that report on the health and performance of your GHES environment
"Audit" drop down works for GHES as well as GitHub.com audit logs
The Alerts menu item contains all GitHub recommended alerts
Audit Log Activity provides a highlevel overview of what activity is going on in GitHub.
Repository Audit lets you review changes to individual or groups of repositories
User Change Audit is the best place to review actions taken by or made to individual users.

h2.b: Software Build! The CI/CD tools that build and test your code in 1 spot

div.p:
With every code commit triggers a Continuous Integration (CI) event and begins the testings and validation steps need to provide high quality secure code.
The Advanced Security Overview dashboard gives insight into the security posture of your GitHub Organization
The Code Scanning Alerts dashboard gives you access to alerts created by Code Scanning within your Organization
The Secret Scanning Alerts dashboard provides visibility into secrets like API keys and personal access tokens that have been checked into your repositories

Artifact Creation and final steps of deploying to production for Continuous Deployment / Delivery (CD) to any cloud environment.
Audit Log data is available through a Splunk Add-On
Rich commit, pull request, and Code Scanning data is available through GitHub Webhooks

Access to all of the ingredients that build your software. Allowing you to search for the next "Log4j", Maintain compliance with executive order 14028, and do proactive Vulnerability Management with Risk reduction.
